author: {'steamid': '76561198105519640', 'num_games_owned': 2329, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1601970448}
review:
Смотрю отрицательные обзоры на эту игру, которые звучат как "на телефоне было очень легко, а на пеке сложно, значит гумус". Захотелось оставить свой. 
Игра хорошая, как plague inc, только в масштабе одного человека. Хочешь - лечи людей, хочешь - убивай. 
Но ранний доступ дает о себе знать: 
- Бывает так, что игра останавливается и дни не идут, приходится много раз переключать меню.
- Иногда центральная часть экрана не отвечает на клики. Лечится перезапуском игры
- Во время всплывающих окон, пару раз картинка уезжала отдыхать заграницу.
Надеюсь, разработчики уже в курсе, и в скором времени это исправят.

10 убитых друзей из 10

Upd.
Со времени публикации обзора прошло полгода, за это время игра продвинулась далеко вперед. Разработчики усердно трудятся над контентом. Добавляют различные задания, испытания, игры на время с другими людьми. Работает стабильно. Так же благодаря Bio Inc. Redemption можно изучить различные болезни, их симптомы и методы лечения. Очень интересно и во многом полезно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012287157', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1512909838}
review:
So frist off, I use to have this on my phone, was much more stripped down as it was the first bio inc.

The game takes up little resources, and the graphics are amazing. The gameplay is nearly identical to the first with a huge overhaul to the tech trees, and still highly addictive.

the only bad thing i can say vs the mobile version is that on mobile you can tap on the blood cells or viruses to get the points, witch lead to much less of a loss. were in this version you have to hold the right mouse button to collect, witch with the +2/+3s you can loose them ocationally.

asside from that one complaint it is not game breaking just makes you have to decide what is more worth it at that time. Great game, and keep it up!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042669538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1520456613}
review:
This is a medical-themed fancy version of whack-a-mole combined with clicking the best tactical options to win the race to recovery or death, depending on which side you choose.

https://youtu.be/octoRLn_UNA

Don't be fooled by the title, this is not a Resident Evil style, zombie-infested FPS game! The basis of the game is that you have a human body in front of you, with eight different views: Circulatory; Respiratory; Digestive; Skeletal; Nervous; Renal; Immune; Muscular. Every few seconds one of these lights up, you click it to select the view and then click/hold on objects that randomly appear in order to collect 'bio points'. Once you amass a certain number of points you spend them via the 'Biomap'. This shows a map of the various body systems, each with a network of symptoms/diseases which either need to be cured or infected, depending on which side you're playing. After you've spent your points you go back to the body view to collect more points and so on.

Instead of spending your point on diseases/cures, you can spend them on Risk Factors. These increase the strength of your power to hurt/cure each body system, and it's a good way to target specific systems to power them up/down. Recovery is the 3rd place you can spend your points. This places good/bad effects on the doctors and nurses working on the patient, and I've found that this can be a good place to target your resources during the end-game, when the patient goes into Emergency mode and the beepers are going crazy.

The game has several different modes and objectives, but you're always racing against either time (real minutes or in-game days), the AI playing the same side or the AI playing the other side, in various different modes. Once a 'match' is over, you receive points if you won and then you rinse and repeat, choosing from many options, booster items and game modes to vary the gameplay as you please.

I have to say, this game would be great for multiplayer. I don't know if this is planned.

[h1]Choose Life/Death[/h1]

There are two main ways you can play. With a name like mine, obviously I've spent most of my time so far playing Death. I've gone from rank 2,000+ to rank #3 and have my eyes on the top spot. The first joy of the game is naming your victim. Enter the name of someone you don't like, and then you can gleefully watch them suffering from all kinds of painful, disgusting and amusing ailments. There's nothing more satisfying than seeing ***** is suffering from explosive diarrhoea. After the first few games this novelty wears off though, and the default John Smith will be the poor sap permanently in hospital.

The Death option is more brute-force and piling on the pressure. Life is slightly more complicated. You have to first diagnose the symptoms by performing (and paying for) many tests, most of which fail. Eventually you get a 'hit' and can treat the symptoms, permanently healing the organ in question. After playing Death it feels like a big waste of points but I've had the same amount of success so I don't think it's actually more difficult, just different. You have to be clever with your selections, using tests which cover multiple symptoms to give you a better chance at a hit.

On a side note, I recently watched Trainspotting 2, and if you haven't seen it you really should, Ewan McGregor's 'Choose Life' dialog in this one is epic!

[h1]Sound & Vision[/h1]

The graphics have a beautiful glowing theme, with bright colours and easily-recognisable icons. The various body system views will blow your socks off, really awesome. The Risk Factors add extra eye candy, with HD burgers, smoke and suchlike, and each has a little animation with sound, some of them pretty funny. It's a more 'static' game than most, so the amount of graphical content is not huge in comparison, but what is provided is up there with the best.

Background music is a gentle repetitive melody, nothing to write home about but not annoying, which is the main thing. In the end-game when the patient is in emergency care you are forced to listen to the loud beep beep beep of the emergency monitor for an extended length of time. I can see the reason for this, but is it really necessary to that extent? It's rather unpleasant.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

There is a wide range of challenge. For a start, each time you start a game you can select Mild, Moderate, Severe or Lethal. You also choose a few 'booster' items which help you with certain aspects of the match. The higher the difficulty you choose, the more skulls/hearts you are awarded. As you amass skulls/hearts, more challenging modes are unlocked and all these different modes and options increase the difficulty on and on, from very easy to near-impossible, and you can choose whatever you like depending on whether you feel like a nice easy match or a hard one to push the envelope.

[h1]Steam[/h1]

Very good achievements, which provide yet another target to aim for, again with a very wide range of difficulty. No trading cards yet. Steam Cloud but no Linux for it to be of use to me (how about it, devs?)

[h1]Value[/h1]

I'm happy to recommend this at full price. It's a slick, beautiful game with endless replay value and barely a hint of its Early Access status.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

The graphics are stunning, every aspect of the game is expertly crafted and it constantly pushes you to improve and take on harder challenges, with leaderboards to drive you on. There are one or two very minor glitches but it feels like a complete, finished game.

The only negative thing I would say is that, despite the huge number of modes and options, the underlying game is essentially the same, to be repeated in ever-increasing intensity. After a while I found myself choosing the same boosters, remembering where the cheapest or most efficient options are located and gradually falling into one particular game plan.

[quote]Lots more reviews at SaveOrQuit.com[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197981289589', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1497722849}
review:
I love this game. It's a very good mix between concentration, wits, swiftness and total pleasure. I really do not regret buying this game. I'm having a lot of fun right now.

For the devlopper : The only thing that I would change in this game is the boosters selection box coming before the mission's objective. You want to select your boosters consequently with the mission's objective, so the selection box would be better after you took notice of the objective. What do you think?

author: {'steamid': '76561198109571944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1496220373}
review:
Игра действительно интересная, и, как мне показалось, более динамична, чем Plague Inc.
У меня не было даже ни одного бага, на которые жаловались пользователи.

Хотелось бы чтобы добавили возможность лечить не только людей, но и каких-нибудь животных, например.
Еще не помешали бы сценарии. Все-таки кроме вылечить и убить могли бы быть и другие варианты, как и вместо систем могло быть что-то другое.
Было бы неплохо, если пользователи могли создавать свои сценарии.

Все эти вещи имеются в Plague Inc. Я думаю здесь они будут смотреться очень здорово.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096428162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1495748528}
review:
This game is simply a treasure!  Do yourself a favor and get it.  It's legitimately the most fun early access game I've ever played - and I frequently try out EA.  It's well worth the money.  Surprisingly, one of my favorite features is the leaderboard.  I'm not a fan of multiplayer games, and this game makes me feel like part of a community without having to interact with other humans.

From a medical standpoint, it's not 100% accurate, but the symptoms and disease tree are close enough to textbook that people with basic medical knowledge (yes, that includes watching House or Grey's Anatomy) will have a lot of fun playing.

You won't regret this purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007865501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1496794703}
review:
Since this is Early Access I wanted to give a review to help the developers and anyone who may be on the fence about purchasing this game.  
  
This game is brilliantly detailed with the symptoms, risk factors, treatments, tests, ext.  Both the being death and being the Doctor has different challenges.  One major issue I see is a very difficult progression system.  After completing 2-4 attempts at both I don't see much advancement to move to different challenges in the Campaign system.  Although its very interesting such a difficult game advancement will make this game repetitive and it will quickly lose its replay value.    
  
For example, I have played the Death campaign a total of 7 times on the two levels that I have unlocked.  After completion of each one they give you a rating in skulls yet I only seem to achieve 1 skull no matter how fast the patient dies or how many symptoms the AI doctors cure.  This doesn't seem to add to my already existing skulls which means I am stuck repeating these two campaign scenarios.  I would not have a problem with this if there was clear descriptions on "how" to earn more skulls.  This is further complicated with a XP bar at the bottom of the screen which only adds the possibility of adding pre-game perks which even with this doesn't help to gain more skulls; as these perks definitely help kill the patient faster.  
 
In my opinion this game is defiantly worth the price since it is in the early access phase.  I have no doubt that the creativity they put into this game will only get better as time goes on.  I just hope they make the progression aspect clearer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993271144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1495619534}
review:
Visually appealing, good counterpart to the android version. Fairly polished for a green light game.   Great to see a decent variation on the pandemic/plague games; good time waster..

There are some show stopper bugs affecting the game:

*Mouse clicks stop working frequently on various buttons - preventing you from completing a game (as you cannot evolve diseases, purchase recovery items, etc ).  
*Sometimes a starting a game the day counter never progresses past zero days. So naturally bio points cannot be collected - its as if the game is paused. 


But its a beta, you should expect these. Overall I like what I see, will be glad to get these bugs sorted in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062930115', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1604018125}
review:
If this game is based on real stuff (as it seems to be) it should serve as a warning point to many people about their habits and what can they change to do better.

In this game you either kill or heal a person. It's that simple. Two ways out - with a twist...

No, no, I am not some crazy person proclaiming healthy diet and life (God knows I havent done that since 28, and I have been gaming since 16, and for creep's sake, I climbed a 3 story building to unlock a friends's door from the inside just to play Karateka on his 8 bit COMP!!!) but I have enough knowledge to know what is happening here.

Ok, now the GOOD.
Disclaimer: I played at work offline. My steam hours are less than the play time because I was forced to play offline. If you find out where I work and I haven't quit yet, go ahead and rat me out to the manager. See if I care.

1. After a confirm/check wiki-ing from a person knowing a wide variety of things, this games looks to be on the point. Watching Dr. House did help a whoole lot as well. Geez now I know why they always check for Lupus. Aaand, what Lupus is (I wikied that 5 years ago, and I remembered, so sue me). And why I should always target it. Was that a spoiler? I hope not...
2. Great strategy layer. I like how the game tries to counteract the stuff you do. Sometimes you feel like House that episode when he cooled off in the fountain and realized that the wheelchair guy didnt commit suicide, but tried to save himself. Revelation at its best. Or not. And in that case you fail. Oh for F'S sake that was a spoiler...
3. If you like to play games AND PAY ATTENTION - and I capsed it for that matter, it is a game that can teach you a lot about yourself. I love the devs for it. You will learn - as a person - a lot. How your habits have positive and negative sides, and how to go the best way. And how crippling diseases can kill even the most upstraight member of the society...
4. I like the atmosphere and the music. Cryptic, and it goes both ways. Not bad at all.

You know this reminds me of a joke.

A guy who likes eating, drinking and smoking sees a funeral procession from the apartment block nearby. Goes over here and asks: I am sorry for your loss, but who was the person? They answer: he drank a lot, smoke a lot, did drugs a lot and ate like a pig!! He goes back, thinks... did smoke, overate and drunk and sheeesh Jesus!! I dont want this on me....

Next day, anothe procession. He asks what happened? Did he smoke, drink, ate a lot?  Oh he was a saint! NO drinking, smoking, always faithful to his wife, he's been granted the paradise for sure!!!

Our guy goes home, lights up a cigarette, pours himself some whiskey, whips out the beef and says - if the difference is only a day, yo... Don't care!

Apart from the joke, the game has some glring issues:

1. Not enough vusial feedback. Yeah you get blood splats, visual degradation of organs, but I can't say whats happening still, unless I pay close attention to the % meters.
2. Huge learning curve on some diseases. While some maladies areextremely easy to manage, others are hard as hell, and the docs will give you a run for their money.
3. I just wish it had more of the Dr. House Balls-Girl episode - people who watched it will know. That was a big plot-twister - and this game could use a few. Let's say, healthy people who jog regularly, go out morning and nights, work, etc. Let us kill or save really healthy people the same way we aspire to be - or make them drink, smoke, take pot and ruin them. That would be good! But then again, it would have to add a serious psychological layer - and while the devs added it, can they bring it up to it's full potential? Let's wait and see.

Conclusion:

For an early access game, this one is worth a shot. Concerning the people who know me, I never go ahead half-blind or half-cocked into early access games unless I know that the game will net me its full price hours 1=1 in bucks. This one will in its tutorials and campaigns. After they add free mode, like the other Inc. games, it will hit even higher boundaries.

I urge you people - take my example. I used few points on purpose, in an attempt not to spoil (if I start quoting wiki, it's a sure-fire win) and not to ruin your experience. Play, learn and act. If a game can help your own life at the price of half your personal weekly exspenditure - it must be doing something right - right?

But then again, remember the bottom line: no person on this earth is always right. Especially doctors. Enough said...

author: {'steamid': '76561197977332304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1495398587}
review:
Bio Inc. Redemption ist ein Echtzeit-Strategiespiel, bei dem Spieler und KI um Leben oder Tod eines Patienten ringen. Sein Körper ist das 'Spielbrett' der Kontrahenten, die entweder schädigend oder heilend an verschiedenen Stellen eingreifen. In der vereinfachten medizinischen Simulation sind Folgeschäden ebenso berücksichtigt, wie äussere Einflüsse, zb. Risikofaktoren und Krankenhausstreiks. 
Die aktuelle Early Access Version ist schon gut spielbar, allerdings nur im Singleplayer - obwohl ein MP Modus von den Entwicklern angedacht ist. Hier stehen noch einige Fragen im Raum: Echtzeit-/Turn-basiert; Live vs. Death / Coop; etc. 

Zwei Sachen fielen mir negativ auf:

- Das Einsammeln der Biopoints, die Währung für weitere Spielzüge, ist nervig.
- Die Time-Progression ist leider nicht frei einstellbar.

Mal sehen, wohin die Reise geht - aktuell kann ich das Spiel für 'zwischendurch' durchaus empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011884492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1664739312}
review:
Извините, но это просто бред, они еще хуже сделали чем версию с телефонов. Разработчики увеличивая сложность не надо делать игру не возможной к прохождению при старте, а надо делать чтобы это вызывало "неожиданно" сложность, вызов! Чтобы не получалось что при старте выбрав первого пациента, установив сложный режим(и это не хардкор) и не имея бустеров, его нельзя пройти из-за того что врачи просто какие-то кудесники становятся и невероятные везения им прут к тому же постоянно! Я не вру, у меня были на одной из попыток прокачены все бонусы к замедлению лечению и т.п., но врачи некоторые болезни вообще вылечивали просто за секунду, только критически можно сказать заставляли их «немного попотеть»! 
Боязнь врачей вообще практически бесполезна, такое чувство на пару секунд оттягивает визит к врачу и все, вау такая полезная способность. Нет не какой способности или возможности опять открыть вылеченные болезни. Зачем нужно это тупое зажимание при подборе вирусов, что не устраивало просто на клике по ним как на телефонах, процесс от этого не стал увлекательней это такой же тупой кликер, зато теперь физически практически невозможно собрать несколько вирусов если они находятся в разных концах на приличном отдалении. Так что в итоге чтобы играть на сложном, вам обязательно надо хотя бы половину пройти на нормале, но зачем так делать?! Ну хорошо да даже если уж хотели кровь из носу, именно так, то надо было просто закрыть возможность выбирать выше нормала! Но я подозреваю зачем так сделали но это так не сработает все равно ваша игра не настолько интересная чтобы тянуло на второе прохождения, ну а донатики на персоналках не очень любят.
Болезней мало, даже еще меньше чем на телефоне, больше половины бесполезны, адекватно по описаниям и показателям нельзя понять что конкретно что делают в итоге. Не помешало бы древо вариативности развить, чтобы при необходимости можно было по другой ветки пройти до цели. Неврологический раздел стал вообще беспомощный в моб версии он реально был сильным правда только в комбе конечно, тут же все скатилось до уровня у меня головка бо-бо и разрушает только свой раздел, хотя внезапно должен как самый минимум разрушать желудок, это даже в описании некоторых болезней сказано. Вообще это было еще в мобильной версии но даже сюда перекочевала несерьезность и глупость в условности некоторых болезней. Вот тот же самый нервный раздел, должен быть одним из самым тяжелым, но только не в мире игры там все скатывается до уровня:
-У меня голова болит доктор 
-Так у вас шизофрения примите вот эту таблеточку.
-Ой помогла, все прошло, спасибо.
 Не какой проработанности, например в плане что при деменции бонус к замедлению лечения так как человек просто не может описать свое состояние. В итоге, печально что вся суть скатывает к одной мете которая имба, а все остальное мусор, зачем спрашивается их делать надо было чтобы на легком и нормале что-то более менее с ними можно было сделать?! Но на нормале даже обычная диарея может убить человека грубо говоря и это не интересно.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198052849241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1584982812}
review:
Great game ! It worth it ! plenty of game modes (6 with my progression) !promissing multiplayer mode in progress ! just take care of the brightness screen if you do not want to looks like a myxomatosis rabbit !!!! loool !

Très bon petit jeu assez sympa et qui mérite qu'on lui donne sa chance.
Incarnez la voie de la lumière et devenez le sauveur d'un homme ou devenez le mal incarné et terrassez l'Homme.

il existe 3*2 donc 6 modes de jeu. Ajouté à cela des boosters qui rendront vos parties uniques !
Je n'ai pas encore débloqué le second palier mais cela promet d'être sympa.

Il n'y a pas encore de mode multijoueur, il est à venir et parait prometteur.

Par contre niveau graphique il impose un réglage de votre écran si vou sne voulez pas ressembler à un lapin contaminé par la myxomatose lol !

Bon habea corpus ou bon fauchage tardive ( pas pour les coccinelles hein !) et amusez vous bien !!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198206046387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1492928747}
review:
I loved the android version of this game. This game is more in-depth and adds extra challenges like playing as the doctors. I do wish that they had added some gender specific features to the game, and possibly a multiplayer option where one person is the doctor and the other is the killer/plague, but overall it is a great game. 
It runs seamlessly on both of my machines and doesn't take a lot of space on my drives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158944444', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1680702318}
review:
I played the android version of this game ( bio inc. biomedical plague ) and I really really loved it, its good to see it on steam

however, this one is more advanced, you can now play as the doctor alongside the homicidal maniac .

good addition to it that it has animations now, its good yes , but it needs some more tweaking and polishing, also adding more animations ( like when the patient goes to ER for example) would be better.

one more thing I need to point out that they should add a female patient as well and tweak the diseases for a bit to be more gender specified.


overall this game is good if you are a medical student or an intern or even a doctor , since it is really close to your field and it might simulate some aspects that you encounter daily.

good luck to the devs and am patiently waiting for the full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260105301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1584352070}
review:
If you enjoy games like Plague Inc you will like this. A more close in depth approach to the human body and health and how to incite or deal with a such a crisis. I hope to see more from this game. The overall UI is intuitive using simle WASD movement and/or point click mechanism. Easy to understand explanations. Very nice graphics. and yes they have an easter egg.

Playing as the hero or villan, is a nice toss in there too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345223604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1503938720}
review:
Bio Inc. was great idea and I played it. Boy it suprised me I somehow stumbled upon this game here actually.
So far from what I played I give developers credit of doubt and say it is good game. Good side was actually what was missing in Bio Inc on Android. I hope all features including multiplayer will be brought in full version although.
Current problems: Recovery as it is. 100% recovery means auto-win for doctor, which is VERY stupid when we take for example that systems are falling, one tree of diseases is not even treated a bit by doctor and patient still facing life-threating conditions. Serious fix would be made in such way that it decreases recovery by all diseases percentage with each new disease. Some lethal diffculity levels are impossible to play because of it as death(at least... not in fair way).

author: {'steamid': '76561198198128134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1619783659}
review:
В далеком 2016, я, в Play Market, увидел игру Bio Inc - Biomedical Plague. Она мне понравилась, но были минусы - реклама, ограничения, и старость моего устройства. "В Steam давно есть игра Plague Inc, так вдруг есть и эта игра?" - таковы были мои мысли. Но, к сожалению, ее в Steam не оказалось. Печальный факт. На смартофнах она продолжала развитие, в то время, как на ПК было перекати поле. 2017 год. Совершенно случайно, просматривая игры со скидкой, я натыкаюсь на похожее название - Bio Inc. Redemption. Не задумываясь, потратил 260 рублей на эту игрую. И что вышло? Эта игра - продолжение той самой игры с Android и iOS устройств. Улучшили графику, прокачали механику заражения и исцеления, и дали нам две ветки - либо мы должны упокоить пациента, как это было на мобильных платформах, либо наоборот, выявить заболевания и вылечить их, пока пациент не умер. Заданий пока не так много (еще бы, ранний доступ, а игра вышла позавчера), но черт подери, это интереснее, чем 1 часть! Кроме простительных багов придраться не к чему.

Плюсы игры (в сравнении с мобильной версией):
+ Новая графика
+ Усовершенствованный геймплей
+ 2 стороны силы
+ Теперь надо реально думать, все стало сложнее
+ (субъективно) Одна игровая сессия стала длиться дольше
+ Это только ранний доступ, дальше будет еще круче

Отдельно хотелось бы сравнить релиз этой игры на PC с релизом той же Plague Inc. В случае Plague Inc, они тупо скопировали то, что было, запихали это в HD текстуры, добавили пользовательские сценарии, и готово. По сути, играя на смартфоне или планшете, вы не потеряете ничего. В случае же с Bio Inc. Redemption, все иначе. Они не стали копировать старое, они переосмыслили его, и сделали совершенно по новому. Даже механику сбора ресурсов переделали. Довольно похвально, для бета версии игры. Не разочаровали. Ожидания полностью оправдались. С нетерпением жду обновлений. Всем советую к покупке и эту версию игры, и мобильную версию) Они обе того стоят :)

Other then that seems pretty good so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367215762', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1495402790}
review:
This game is great as an Early Access game. I wanted to leave a review because this is a brand new game and I wanted to help fellow gamers that are on the edge of buying whether this game is legit or not. 

IT IS! 

It's a well developed game that you can interact with each branch set. Plenty of options to play through with different type of game modes. It hasn't crashed at all for me and it's a pretty stable game.

Only bug I've noticed so far is that sometimes certain icons become unclickable as if your click pointer isn't getting recognized. It's pretty annoying when you're in the middle of trying to evolve certain branches but can't because it's unclickable. An easy fix for that is to just close the application and restart it back up. It will work again and your game is automatically saved.

Have fun!
